Detailed Description

Parameters structure of the APS_DataReq() function. The APSDE-DATA.request primitive.

struct { ... } APS_DataReq_t::service

Used for queue support

APS_AddrMode_t APS_DataReq_t::dstAddrMode

The addressing mode for the destination address used in this primitive and the APDU to be transferred. May possess any non-reserved value from the following list:
0x00 = DstAddress and DstEndpoint are missing
0x01 = 16-bit group address for DstAddress, DstEndpoint is missing
0x02 = 16-bit address for DstAddress, DstEndpoint is present
0x03 = 64-bit extended address for DstAddress, DstEndpoint is present
0x04 - 0xff = reserved
Note: It will be convenient to use the APS_AddrMode_t values

Definition at line 386 of file aps.h.

APS_Address_t APS_DataReq_t::dstAddress

The address of the individual device or group address of the entity to which the ASDU is being transferred.

Definition at line 390 of file aps.h.

Endpoint_t APS_DataReq_t::dstEndpoint

This parameter shall be present if and only if the DstAddrMode parameter value is 0x02 or 0x03 and, if present, shall contain either the number of individual endpoints of the entity to which the ASDU is being transferred, or the broadcast endpoint (0xff).

Definition at line 396 of file aps.h.

The identifier of the profile for which this frame is intended.

The identifier of the object for which this frame is intended.

Endpoint_t APS_DataReq_t::srcEndpoint

The individual endpoint of the entity from which the ASDU is being transferred.

Definition at line 402 of file aps.h.

uint8_t APS_DataReq_t::asduLength

The number of octets comprising the ASDU to be transferred. The maximum length of an individual APS frame payload is given as NsduLength-apscMinHeaderOverhead. Assuming the possibility of fragmentation, a maximum-sized single ASDU consists of 256 such blocks.

Definition at line 407 of file aps.h.

uint8_t* APS_DataReq_t::asdu

The set of octets comprising the ASDU to be transferred.

Definition at line 409 of file aps.h.

APS_TxOptions_t APS_DataReq_t::txOptions

<0000 xxxx> (Where x can be 0 or 1) The transmission options for the ASDU to be transferred. Must be selected among the following values:
0x01 = Security enabled transmission,
0x02 = Use NWK key,
0x04 = Acknowledged transmission,
0x08 = Fragmentation permitted,
probably combined by logical OR.
It is fine to use the APS_TxOptions_t enumerations.

Definition at line 419 of file aps.h.

uint8_t APS_DataReq_t::radius

The distance, in hops, that a transmitted frame will be allowed to travel via the network.
